DOCNAME: CASE OF SCURCI CHIMENTI v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in LOC .
CARDINAL . The applicant is the owner of an apartment in LOC , which she had let to ORG and ORG

CARDINAL . In a registered letter of CARDINAL DATE , the applicant informed the tenants that she intended to terminate the lease on expiry of the term on DATE and asked them to vacate the LOC by DATE .
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenants on CARDINAL DATE , the applicant reiterated her intention to terminate the lease and summoned the tenants to appear before the Leghorn Magistrate .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , which was made enforceable on DATE , the Leghorn Magistrate upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant served notice on the tenants requiring them to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant made a statutory declaration that she urgently required the premises as accommodation for herself .
CARDINAL . On DATE , she served notice on the tenants informing them that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .
CARDINAL . Between DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession .
CARDINAL . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was never granted the assistance of the police in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the tenants asked ORG to postpone the execution of the order for possession , pursuant to LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant served a second notice on the tenants informing them that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , pursuant to LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE , ORG postponed the execution of the order for possession until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE and on DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts , which proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was not granted the assistance of the police in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . In the meanwhile , on DATE , the applicant made a statutory declaration that she urgently needed the apartment for herself .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant recovered possession of the apartment .
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law is described in the ORG 's judgment in the case of ORG GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-V.
